alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Rawlins; Sherman (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 18 at 8:40PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT/1 AM CDT/ TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Colorado and northwest Kansas, including the following counties, in northeast Colorado, Yuma. In northwest Kansas, Cheyenne, Rawlins and Sherman. * WHEN...Until midnight MDT /100 AM CDT/. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 740 PM MDT /840 PM CDT/, An off duty NWS employee has reported flooding occurring along Beaver Creek, affecting County Road 74, estimated 6 miles east of Hwy 27. Other locales in the warning area are expected to be impacted over the next couple of hours, especially secondary roadways. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Goodland, Kanorado, Ruleton and Edson. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
